post.body: That's on Cooper's Christmas list. Any fun?
Bolt's been out for a few weeks, has been wildly successful. Even popular movies dontlast too long anymore.
Sounds like the occupants of that doll house might be getting visits from the authorities.
Hey man, I was nowhere NEAR your desk.
"Slumdog" … India-set violent, romantic, dramedy with fantasy elements, but that description belittles it.
Clearly the "words failing" problem does NOT run in the family.
Twitterfon is the BEST. It had major issues last week after a Twitter update, but all ironed out now.
Is it just me? Your link takes me to a page about a unicyclist named Gilby. Or is that your new goal?
Miss hearing u Stever. Keep tweeting. Enjoy staying up late. :-)
I have a DS brain game with a Sudoku function, but it's not very good. There are so many great Sudoku apps for my iPod Touch, though
If you want to recycle that warped lid, just … wait, nevermind. I think I just wandered into a Steven Wright bit.
I often wish I had never seen it so I could watch it all for the first time again.
Are u a new watcher? That show is THE BEST.
What's an "infected computer?" (he types, on his Apple keyboard.)
Thanks! I'm following a few more people thanks to your tip.
I'm afraid our teams could be toppled by anyone with a pair of loafers and halfway decent aim.
Welcome to the club. :-(
In November, 1973 the Austin American and the Austin Statesman combined to become the Austin American-Statesman.
Need to unfollow you. Sorry. Can't take the constant alltop ads.
"Son, we never said we hoped you'd grow up to be a veterinarian. We said we hoped you'd grow up to be a 'veteran Aryan'."
Drew Petersen engaged to a 23-year old? I'm missing ya bad right now, Stever!
Have you tried Twitterfon? Fast and free!
I'll follow you, but I am through with the Cubs. I can't take that again.
We went to Christmas Family Night. Honestly, found it much too crowded to participate in anything, but still had a good time.
Serious envy. U don't even want to know what model of ancient Mac beastie I'm running here. :-(
Camping with my then 10-year old son/scout in a freezing winter downpour was both the worst and best night of my life.
Artie, maybe. Most of my Sopranos knowledge has faded to black.
Yeah. I think he caused some trouble with their restaurant friend ... Arnie?
The creepy Doogie friend who grew up to join Tony Soprano's "family?"
Somebody gave you as a reference? That freaks me out, too!
parasailing?
So true! I LOVE wearing pancakes!
Great. All we need is bigger d**ks stirring up trouble in the middle east.
@twitterkins Please don't scare me like that. His DREAMS are his ticket out. ::gentle sob:: ... his ... dreams ...
Merry Christmas, Stever!
Spent first part of birthday watching "Tale of Despereaux" with my girl. It's gonna be a tough one to review.
Go Bears! OT win!
Has @robquig got that party rockin' yet?
One LBJ student group magazine had a story about and photo of @broylesa!
Just got back from critiquing LASA electronic magazine designs at LBJ High. Some smart kids doing some good, creative work!
Not surprised that Gitmo plays Britney to break prisoners. I hear that crap on the car radio and *I* start calling in confessions.
Two minutes of the biggest, fluffiest snow flakes in Round Rock followed by endless sleet -- the kind that hits so hard it's painful.
RT @shoehurler Who are you mad at? Direct message me and I'll toss a virtual shoe at 'em for you!
Working up my list of top five family films of 2008 for @statesman
"Tale of Despereaux" review in. 2 stars. I guess I liked it less than I thought I did.
Struggling with "Despereaux" review. I prefer opining on films about which I feel strongly; ambivalence doesn't translate well to print.
rt @BuzzFeedFeed The entire series of "Arrested Development" is on sale right now at Amazon for thirty bucks! http://tinyurl.com/6nwklp
rt: @astrospace Warning: spammer @christhatesher has posted suspicious url. Do not click on it.
I like " 'Twas the Night Before Christmas" okay, except for the part about "throwing up the sash," which is just gross.
Mmmmm ... beam me up, biscotti.
Geek quote o' day, by MacDailyNews: "Microsoft's Windows Mobile 'competes' with Apple iPhone as Jabba The Hut 'competes' with Usain Bolt."
Boy, do I feel yucky.'Sgonna be a long day.
Starting to think tomorrow's switch to AT&T uVerse was just a very clever ploy to get me to clean under, behind and around TVs & computers.
Anybody know of any Austin theaters that might have open stages on Feb. 14 & 15th? If so, please DM me. If not, please re-tweet. Thanks!
Where did my authority go? If I'm going to be a decorator I might as well actually get out of newspapers and into the decorating business.
I wish "morning drive" was less radio term and more applicable personal quality.
The in-laws have left the building. Wisely only took the bait on *one* political argument this year, and I won it.
Jolly old St. Nicotine: http://twitpic.com/wezx
Wow. First Christmas EVER we've woken up before the kids. Times are changing. Merry Christmas everybody!
Whew! Last present wrapped; children are nestled all snug in their beds. Santa is tired.
